name: sweatily
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that involves sweat (= the clear, salty liquid that you pass through your skin), or causes you to be wet with sweat: Twice a week I would take our two children to their grandparents, and then rush sweatily to London for a meeting. Particularly in summer, the resort can be sweatily humid, as well as hot.
More examplesFewer examplesWhile Mark sweatily attempted to hide his embarrassment, Craig emerged with dignity.For a few sweatily anxious minutes, I feared the theatre might have made a mess of this.Live music is about sharing an experience in a stadium that's heaving sweatily with 70,000 other people.
